dogecoin.text:
Today, in many ways, Dogecoin has become what Palmer wanted to avoid.

A speculative asset that has attracted people seeking to make a quick buck. 

With a market cap nearing $100 billion, who knows where Dogecoin will go. https://t.co/XoxWT6umqX

In 2015 though, Palmer stepped away from Dogecoin. The commercialization of the cryptocurrency, along with several fraudulent events and his own hesitancy, made him sell his holdings in Dogecoin and step back from the project. 

Palmer used his earnings to buy a used honda civic.

Doge for Water 

The Dogecoin foundation raised 40m Dogecoin to fund the creation of two water wells. 
https://t.co/fx22PNx3OK

Surprised by its initial success, Palmer sought to mold Dogecoin in his image. 

Palmer disliked the speculative nature of other cryptocurrencies and the money-grabbing behavior he associated with bitcoin.  

To counter this, Dogecoin developed a uniquely altruistic community

When Dogecoin went live, Palmer expected the cryptocurrency to survive for a week and then for everyone to forget about it. 

However, it quickly developed its own community. 

In a counter-intuitive twist, the ridiculousness of the Dogecoin attracted people towards it.

Because of Palmer's hesitancy around cryptocurrencies, a lot of Dogecoin's initial design was built around making the network as ridiculous as possible. 

For example, initially, they put in a random block reward that made mining Dogecoin highly uncertain.

Instead of fixing it, Jae Kwon encouraged them to keep it. 

This is the main difference between Dogecoin and Bitcoin since Doge has no hard cap.  Dogecoin's supply can infinitely expand because new coins are being added.
Using litecoin as its base, Dogecoin is similar to bitcoin. It runs on a decentralized ledger and has a similar framework. However, since it is based on litecoin, transaction speeds are quicker.
After seeing Dogecoin on an online forum, software engineer Billy Markus reached out to Palmer and offered to help him build out the network.

Skeptical of cryptocurrencies, and a huge fan of memes, Palmer jokingly tweeted about his fake cryptocurrency Dogecoin. 

To his surprise, his tweet received a lot of attention in crypto circles.

Over the weekend, Elon Musk hosted SNL! 

Many people expected this to be a landmark moment for Dogecoin, however, it lost 30% of its value as Musk called it a "hustle".

Instead of propelling Dogecoin "to the moon" 🚀, the "Dogefather" offered a discount. 

A 🧵 on  Dogecoin: https://t.co/LyBtnctPv2
